text: Pas impressionné. Un ossobuco minuscule et coriace faut le faire. La place est bien, le service aussi, mais pas plus. Pour le prix, il y a beaucoup mieux dans le secteur.
Acceuil chaleureux, personnel souriant et nourriture excellente. A découvrir! Cuisine italienne, un bon verre de vin, quoi demander de mieux!

Came here in November 2017, 2 adults and 3 kids. The kids enjoyed their meals and Caldo gives them many choices so that's a plus. I ordered the crispy pancetta pizza which I really enjoyed. The toppings were excellent and so was the dough. My boyfriend however ordered the romanoff penne with giant shrimps and had to send it back as the sauce was bland and watered down. We also ordered the fried calamari to start and it was delicious. 

Overall, everyone enjoyed their meals, but I gotta say, its a pizzeria and not a pastaria (you get my point), so your best bet is to order a pizza if you want to be happy with your meal. As well, I did find it a bit pricey, especially considering the location (not central). However, the service was excellent and very accommodating towards children, so that's a plus if you come here with your family. 

For my full review and more photos, check out my blog: Turquoise Blog (link in bio!)

Bon service. Il parait que les tartares sont un must, j'essaierai à nouveau. Une belle surprise toutefois, j'ai aimé

My boyfriend and I went there to try their 21$ menu for "MTL à Table"; we were a bit nostalgic of our trip in Italy, and Caldo did not disappoint! 
The restaurant has a very warm, welcoming feel, with large tables for groups and bar seating too. We came in on a Saturday evening and it was packed. Noise level was tolerable though (then again, we were seated in a corner, away from the large groups). 

We tried both the arancini and the squash soup appetizers, and both were delicious. The seafood pizza was surprisingly large and well-garnished, a proper wood-oven pie (there was just a bit too much crust to my liking). As for dessert, the tiramisu somewhat lacked in coffee flavour, but the panna cotta was great: I wished the portion was bigger, it was so good!

Special thanks to our patient waitress, the service was impeccable!

Despite a major screw-up, the food here was amazing and the decor was really nice. The servers were also friendly. 
We came for an early dinner, and were one of the first parties seated in the dining room. We ordered a pasta entree (appetizer) and two pizzas. We were hungry from a long day of sightseeing. After 45 minutes, the restaurant was completely full, and we were starving. Other tables were getting their food. The server came and told us that the kitchen had made a mistake, so our pasta would be complimentary.  After twenty more minutes the pasta came out - and it was the most delicious pasta I've ever had! The primavera. My boyfriend was upset, though, because he wanted pizza and wasnt going to have any pasta - when they realized the kitchen mistake, they shouldve brought bread and/or fired the pizzas! When the pizzas finally arrived, about 75 minutes after we ordered, they were delicious.

Le technopôle Angus n'a pas fini de faire parler de lui en matière de bonnes adresses... S'ajoute à Labarake et à Mamie Clafoutis un nouveau resto  : Pizzeria Caldo. 
Toujours dans une ambiance 100% industrielle, on découvre un restaurant chaleureux avec un accueil impeccable et un menu alléchant. Je me suis laissée tenter par une pizza margarita, elle était délicieuse et ultra savoureuse. Les assiettes sont bien garnies à un prix très raisonnable. 
J'y retourne les yeux fermés !

I wanted to like this place so much. I did. As beautiful as the restaurant is, I won't go back. 4 pizzas, 3 were mediocre and the seafood pizza smelled (too much smell). The calamari was ordinary and the salad was boring. Damn... I'm quite disappointed. I'd give it 3 stars but it was even expensive for what it was. Sorry.

Nichée dans le pôle Angus, cette pizzeria semble ne jamais désemplir! 

Faute de pouvoir manger au Thaï sur Rachel fermé le samedi, nous avons opté pour la pizzeria la plus proche. 
Une terrasse tranquille avec une belle pelouse alentour qui offre un petit côté nature à la place décorée champêtre. 

Le service est vraiment excellent! 
Les pizzas sont copieuses et bonnes, pâte fine et cuisson parfaite, avec un double choix végé (ce qui est assez rare pour une pizzeria). Mon conjoint a choisi celle aux tomates séchées qu'il a trouvé bonne. Pour ma part j'ai choisi celle au gravlax de saumon, très bonne également, même si le cuisto avait échappé un peu trop d'aneth.

On a été comblé par la carte des vins quasiment tous d'importation italienne privée, donc bien heureux d'accorder les saveurs à nos verres!

Des peluches sont disponibles pour les enfants, un plus pour la quiétude de chacun!

Le restaurant est très beau et le service est excellent. Malheureusement, la croûte de ma pizza était beaucoup trop cuite et crunchy. J'y retournais une prochaine fois pour donner une autre chance mais je ne commanderais pas la pizza.

J'étais super impatiente d'essayer cette pizzeria et mon souhait s'est réalisé récemment alors voici mon avis! Je me suis rendue à ce resto avec une ancienne collègue de travail. Le resto était plein à craquer et rapidement, on ne pouvait plus s'entendre parler. Très désagréable à ce niveau pour moi, qui est agressée par le bruit. Le service était très bon, rien à redire à ce sujet. Niveau bouffe, j'ai opté pour la célèbre pizza proscuitto et figues, un des meilleurs vendeurs. Je n'ai pas été impressionnée. Les garnitures étaient certes intéressantes, mais la pâte à pizza était plutôt coriace. On s'est toutefois repris au niveau des desserts, qui se sont démarqués!! Il m'a coûté environ 40$ pour un verre de vin, une pizza et un dessert, je trouve que c'est raisonnable. Petite note: le stationnement du resto est payant alors je vous conseille de vous stationner sur la rue plutôt que dans le stationnement en tant que tel. Il y a toujours de la place.

What a lovely place! 

I've been there twice and I had an amazing experience during both visits. 

First time I had a table d'hôte and I have to say that it was surprised. Excellent food and fair price. 

Second time I went for the pizza. Who doesn't love pizza?? Because I do... but despite the fact that I'm a pizza-lover, I have to say that these guys nailed it! 

With great options on menu they just amazed me and made my evening very special.

The restaurant was almost closing because it was empty (it was a working day). We were a group of 6 and a waitress stayed with the kitchen staff just for us. 

She was very kind and very sweet with us all. 

Guys... I have one thing to say to you... BRB!

I went there with my boyfriend and 2 friends and everyone liked their food. I had sea food pizza that was very very excellent. The only pity thing was that i ask to remove clam and add more shrimp instead and they add an extra on the bill. But except that, the food was good, the atmosphere of the place is nice and the service perfect.
